venue.name: Boys and Girls Club of South Boston

item.description:
Hi Boston Volunteers!

 

Date/Time: Sunday March 17th - 9:45 am- 12:15 pm

Please cap volunteers at 15

Location: Boys and Girls Club South Boston - 230 West 6th St. (Corner of W. 6th and F St.)


Looking for the perfect way to celebrate St. Patrick's Day? South Boston is the place! Kick off the celebration by volunteering at the Boys and Girls Club of South Boston St. Patrick's Day Road Race. This annual fundraiser helps support after-school programming, for kids 6-18, that builds educational and character development. Volunteer roles include assisting inside the club pre-race, staffing the race course and/or cheer zones, assisting when the runners return to the club including distributing water/snacks and ushering them through the finish line. Specific assignments will be emailed out 5 days prior to the event.
All volunteers receive a commemorative long-sleeved tee shirt designed by the Dropkick Murphy’s and duties will be over by 12:15 pm, in plenty of time to get your spot along the parade route, if you choose.

 

Thank you so much for your interest!

Best,

Nancy (nancy_kukulan@yahoo.com)


 

The Boston Volunteers

Big enough to deliver, small enough to care

Learn more: www.BostonVolunteer.org


Learn more about your fellow Boston Volunteers:

P.S. Please friend popular Paulette.

Who is Paulette:http://www.facebook.com/paulette.revere.7

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: St. Patrick's Day Road Race: Help out the Boys and Girls Club
